page.title: 10Housing in Mousehole
page.content: {Mousehole}developed as a{fishing} village and it is known to have been in existance, with its name spelt in various ways, since 1284. The coast shape provided a sheltered cove and the island, although some distance from the shore, a form of breakwater. There is only one house in Mousehole today which was built before 1595. The reason for this is that the Spaniards attacked Mousehole in that year and all but the 'Keigwin Arms' were burned to the ground. However the houses that were built after this are huddled together with narrow streets and are made of{granite.} {Newer houses}and bungalows that have been built around the outside have used more modern materials, while the net lofts and cellars of the old houses are now let out to {summer {visitors.
